intro: Hieracium leptoconium, commonly known as the slender-haired hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and is typically found in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. The plant produces yellow composite flowers that consist of both ray and disk florets, typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Hieracium leptoconium is often considered an invasive species in certain regions due to its rapid growth and ability to spread prolifically.
